Milestone Event: First electronic general-purpose computer = ENIAC
Why Important: Faster decisions using a computer and mathmatics

Milestone Event: John von Neumann creates a merge sort algorithm| in which the first and second halves of an array are each sorted recursively and then merged
Why Important: Arrays allow mathmatics| grouping and sorting of data

Milestone Event: The first computer hard disk used
Why Important: Storing data for reuse = reduces time to recreate data from scratch from programming

Milestone Event: The modem invented
Why Important: Communication between computers| foundation of the internet| sending / receiving data

Milestone Event: Statistician John Tukey defined data analysis
Why Important: Defined the process and procedures of collecting data for analysis without being a statistian

Milestone Event: Dr. E.F. Codd creates concept of "normalizing data"| relational models and foundation to storing data in databases
Why Important: Made data independent from specific software / coding langauges and created framework for storing and retrieving data using rows (tuples)| columns and tables (entities)

Milestone Event: FORTRAN Programing Language supports comma seperated value (csv) file formats
Why Important: Programing Language can input / output data files with consistent results

Milestone Event: Bloomberg Terminal Introduced
Why Important: Financial Data Analysis of Bond Market to market makers without being a programmer

Milestone Event: Edward Tufty writes the book "The Visual Display of Quantitative Information "
Why Important: Defines ways to communicate with data beyond tables and numbers

Milestone Event: SQL Language Standardized across all database technologies
Why Important: A common language agnostic to technology for storing vasts amounts of data in a centralized location

Milestone Event: Microsoft Excel
Why Important: Mainstream productivity software available to anyone in business world

Milestone Event: The term “BI (Business Intelligence)” was proposed by Howard Dresner at Gartner in 1989
Why Important: Data becomes as Asset = used for analysis to make decisions from

Milestone Event: On-Line Analytical Processing (OLAP) and Business Intelligence become industry standards
Why Important: Data Volumes Increase| specialized software and skills required to answer questons from data

Milestone Event: Guido van Rossum creates the Python programming language
Why Important: Programming language that has versility beyond specific usage like back end processing or front end User Interface (UI)

Milestone Event: Finnish engineer Linus Torvalds introduces the Linux operating system. Price: $0.
Why Important: Open Source software and Programming Languages become available to anyone without costs

Milestone Event: Bill Inmon writes "Building the data warehouse"
Why Important: Organize data in a way to gain insights and answer business questions

Milestone Event: QlikView software created
Why Important: Distruptive Technology that removes barriers from answering questions using data but creating software that does everything in one place = ingest data| etl| data visual

Milestone Event: Ralph Kimball writes "The data warehouse toolkit"
Why Important: Enables growth of the data analyst and business intelligence professional = understand requirements to ground swell data marts

Milestone Event: XML Created
Why Important: The goals of XML emphasize simplicity| generality| and usability across the Internet.

Milestone Event: The journal Data Mining and Knowledge Discovery is launched; the reversal of the order of the two terms in its title reflecting the ascendance of “data mining” as the more popular way to designate “extracting information from large databases.”
Why Important: Evolving Data Mining as a skill moving away from specific technologies needed to answer questions without specfic expertise in 1 technology

Milestone Event: Carlo Strozzi introduced the concept of NoSQL and non-relational databases
Why Important: Removed defined structures required by Relational Databases to store values by key-value and catalist for Big Data solutions like Google BigTable| Amzaon DynamoDB and Graph Databases (social networks)

Milestone Event: REST / APIs
Why Important: Data Democracy = If i can use a browser| I can access data without the need to batch process

Milestone Event: Natural Language Toolkit
Why Important: statistical natural language processing (NLP) for English written in the Python programming language

Milestone Event: JSON was first presented to the world at the JSON.org website in 2001
Why Important: Evolved from XML| data agnostic to the programing langauge that created it

Milestone Event: Stephen Few publishes Information Dashboard Design: The Effective Visual Communication of Data
Why Important: Evolves data viz as a skill and effective means of communication.  New careers in Business Intelligence and Data Visualization

Milestone Event: facebook
Why Important: The Social Network influences people and data are communicating

Milestone Event: Google Analytics
Why Important: A web search engine and metadata (data about the data) become a product that businesses will pay to use

Milestone Event: Apache Hadoop Big Data Storage Created
Why Important: The Data Lake offers alternatives to data marts and traditional data warehouses.

Milestone Event: NumPy Library Introduced
Why Important: Python language library grows beyond programing to data analysis tool

Milestone Event: Twitter
Why Important: Unstructured Big Data offers opportunities for analysis of data beyond traditional limits.  The need for Data Scientists becomes a career aspiration

Milestone Event: Amazon Web Services (AWS) S3 storage and introduced its Elastic Compute Cloud (EC2)
Why Important: Cloud computing = boundries to physical computers is removed.   Information technology (IT) segments into specialized fields

Milestone Event: GitHub
Why Important: Version control and sharing of code between teams| departments and industries become easier and fasters

Milestone Event: Apple iPhone
Why Important: Mobile Analytics becomes an industry

Milestone Event: pandas is a software library created
Why Important: Python evolves to the tool for open source data analysis

Milestone Event: Uber Founded
Why Important: Using Data and Technology to disrupt the transportation industry

Milestone Event: Kaggle.com created
Why Important: Data Democracy in action = reward ANYONE who can solve problems using data and algorthems

Milestone Event: Naomi Robbins founds the Data Visualization New York Meetup
Why Important: Pioneering Woman Engineer and Data Visualization expert who runs the largest offline community of data visualization professionals in the world

Milestone Event: Creation of the Raspberry PI
Why Important: Making the IOT (Internet of Things) mass scale of data with a device that costs only $25

Milestone Event: Alberto Cairo publishes the "The Functional Art: An introduction to information graphics and visualization (Voices That Matter)"
Why Important: Charts become an artform and careers like data journalism become mainstream

Milestone Event: Project Jupyter
Why Important: Open Source code and libraries becomes an all in one tool that's easier to use

Milestone Event: Amazon Alexa Ecosystem
Why Important: Making voice to data mainstream and allowing API integration by other vendors

Milestone Event: The Data Literacy Project launches
Why Important: Building a data driven culture where anyone can read| work with| analze and argue with data
